title: Club Penguin
content:
So, you might notice that I've been doing a lot less around the Keen community these days. That's because most of my creative juices have been going towards an online project, but I haven't been able to tell anyone because it's not public yet.

Well now, it is! www.ClubPenguin.com is online. It's basically an animated chat room targeted towards the 8-13 age group. I realize that's younger than most everyone here, but it's still worth checking out.

EDIT: No, I did not create it single-handedly. I am merely the main artist/animator of it. Most every piece of art that's not backgrounds or interface is what I worked on.[url=http://www.screenhog.com]www.screenhog.com[/url]

title: Re: Club Penguin
content:
That is yours???
Cool!
I notice from the banner thingy at the top right there are more features than I thought before, when I saw the test version or something.
I'm going to try this out sometime.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Club Penguin
content:
Woah, that's awesome job Ilsoap!

Someone posted about this site just recently, but I guess the site wasn't "officially opened" although it was accessible. It's really neat; great work.Eat your veggies!

title: Well...
content:
OK, just so you know, I didn't make the whole thing. I'm nowhere near that level of programmer. My work was in the more artistic stuff (making the penguins, clothes, and furniture, creating the Bean Counters and Astro-Barrier games, some website art).

Glad you like it!

title: Re: Oh My Gosh!!!
content:
No, I don't own it. I'm just the main animator on it.

And the marriage question is a long story... but yes, Rebecca and I had a marriage ceremony on August 26th to start the paperwork for her becoming a permanent resident of Canada. The date we're considering our real wedding is April 22 of next year.[url=http://www.screenhog.com]www.screenhog.com[/url]

title: Re: Oh My Gosh!!!
content:

Hmmm, other forum software has that, and I understand eventually the PCKF will move, so... a matter of patience.

title: Re: humum
content:
You can call your penguin any name you choose (assuming it gets past the filter for bad words). If Commander Keen isn't taken yet, you could walk around Club Penguin calling yourself Commander Keen and we wouldn't have a problem with it.

About your password, because of privacy rules, we do not have access to your password. If you want to change your password, you do so in Settings at the bottom of the screen (the little ? mark). If you've forgotten your password, there's a link at the login screen that should help you.[url=http://www.screenhog.com]www.screenhog.com[/url]
